metadata.titleEn: Exceptionally well-preserved crocodilian coprolites from the Late Eocene of Northern Vietnam: Ichnology and paleoecological signiﬁcance
metadata.description: (1) This data includes Late Eocene crocodile feces fossils and spore pollen original images in the surrounding environment of the Na Duong Basin in Vietnam, CT (fault) scanning images, size measurement images, geographic location original images, and reconstruction images of the Eocene paleoenvironment. (2) The main ways to obtain data are through camera field shooting and laboratory depth of field overlay shooting, CT export, and the use of relevant software generation. (3) The image quality is a high-resolution original size image. (4) The prospect of image application is that it can be used for further in-depth research and comparison.
metadata.instructions: (1) This data includes Late Eocene crocodile feces fossils and spore pollen original images in the surrounding environment of the Na Duong Basin in Vietnam, CT (fault) scanning images, size measurement images, geographic location original images, and reconstruction images of the Eocene paleoenvironment. (2) The main ways to obtain data are through camera field shooting and laboratory depth of field overlay shooting, CT export, and the use of relevant software generation. (3) The image quality is a high-resolution original size image. (4) The prospect of image application is that it can be used for further in-depth research and comparison.

Example.Question: Can you provide an example of data collection methods used to study crocodylian coprolites and their surrounding environments from the Late Eocene in Northern Vietnam?
Example.Answer: A data collection method involves using field cameras for capturing images of crocodylian coprolites and surrounding environments, employing laboratory techniques such as focus stacking photography, and utilizing CT scanning to generate high-resolution images. These methods are used to obtain high-quality, original-sized images that can be further analyzed for research purposes.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the specific features and techniques used in capturing high-resolution images for understanding late Eocene paleoenvironments in northern Vietnam?
Feature Specification.Answer: field photography, depth stacking, CT scanning, software for image generation

Quantification.Question: How many high-resolution original size images are typically collected for a dataset related to late Eocene crocodilian coprolites in northern Vietnam?
Quantification.Answer: The original answer does not provide a specific numerical value or range for the number of high-resolution original size images collected for the dataset. Therefore, there is no quantifiable information to extract.

Definition.Question: What is the process of obtaining high-resolution images for paleontological research?
Definition.Answer: High-resolution images for paleontological research can be obtained through methods such as field photography using cameras, laboratory depth-stacking photography, and exporting images from CT (computed tomography) scans.

Causal Consequence.Question: What are the potential consequences on the quality and usability of a dataset when using high-resolution original size images from field and laboratory settings for paleoenvironment reconstructions?
Causal Consequence.Answer: Using high-resolution original size images from field and laboratory settings can enhance the quality and usability of a dataset by providing detailed and accurate visual data that supports in-depth analysis and comparison, leading to more precise paleoenvironment reconstructions.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What are the detailed procedures and techniques used to collect and process high-resolution images of crocodilian coprolites and surrounding pollen fossils in the late Eocene deposits of northern Vietnam?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The data collection methods involve using cameras for field photography and laboratory depth stacking photography, CT scanning for cross-sectional images, and the use of related software to generate images. These procedures ensure high-resolution, original-size images suitable for further research and comparison.

Enablement.Question: What technological advancements enable the collection and enhancement of high-resolution images of Eocene crocodylian coprolites and surrounding environments?
Enablement.Answer: The collection and enhancement of high-resolution images of Eocene crocodylian coprolites and surrounding environments are enabled by advancements in camera technology for field photography, laboratory depth stacking photography, CT (computed tomography) scanning, and image generation using specialized software.
